title: Part A
stimulusHtml:
3 points maximum

Construct graph (3 points)

· Correctly plotted means on a bar graph/modified bar graph

· Appropriate labels, units, and scaling

· Correct plotted error bars
descriptions:
Student response earns none of the following points.

Construct graph (3 points)

· Correctly plotted means on a bar graph/modified bar graph

· Appropriate labels, units, and scaling

· Correct plotted error bars

Student response earns one of the following points.

Construct graph (3 points)

· Correctly plotted means on a bar graph/modified bar graph

· Appropriate labels, units, and scaling

· Correct plotted error bars

Student response earns two of the following points.

Construct graph (3 points)

· Correctly plotted means on a bar graph/modified bar graph

· Appropriate labels, units, and scaling

· Correct plotted error bars

Student response earns three of the following points.

Construct graph (3 points)

· Correctly plotted means on a bar graph/modified bar graph

· Appropriate labels, units, and scaling

· Correct plotted error bars

title: Part B
stimulusHtml:
2 points maximum

Description (2 points)

Short-term: Caffeine does not affect short-term memory/memory at 10 minutes.

Long-term: Caffeine improves/increases the long-term memory/memory at 24 hours.
descriptions:
Student response earns none of the following points.

Description (2 points)

Short-term: Caffeine does not affect short-term memory/memory at 10 minutes.

Long-term: Caffeine improves/increases the long-term memory/memory at 24 hours.

Student response earns one of the following points.

Description (2 points)

Short-term: Caffeine does not affect short-term memory/memory at 10 minutes.

Long-term: Caffeine improves/increases the long-term memory/memory at 24 hours.

Student response earns two of the following points.

Description (2 points)

Short-term: Caffeine does not affect short-term memory/memory at 10 minutes.

Long-term: Caffeine improves/increases the long-term memory/memory at 24 hours.

title: Part C
stimulusHtml:
3 points maximum

Identification (3 points; 1 point per category)

Null hypothesis:

· Increasing caffeine concentration has no effect (on the number of floral visits by bees).

Control:

· (Nectar/flowers with) no caffeine

Predicted results

· The number of floral visits by bees is different at increasing caffeine concentrations.

· The number of floral visits by bees is different than the control.

title: Part D
stimulusHtml:
2 point(s) maximum

Proposed plant benefit (1 point)

· More pollen is transferred/more visits by pollinators.

· plants store energy/have more energy available for other uses.

Proposed bee cost (1 point)

· (individual) bees visit more flowers.

· (individual) bees use more energy.

· The colony/bees may produce less honey

· The colony/bees may produce lower quality honey/honey that provides less energy.
descriptions:
Student response earns none of the following points.

Proposed plant benefit (1 point)

· More pollen is transferred/more visits by pollinators.

· plants store energy/have more energy available for other uses.

Proposed bee cost (1 point)

· (individual) bees visit more flowers.

· (individual) bees use more energy.

· The colony/bees may produce less honey

· The colony/bees may produce lower quality honey/honey that provides less energy.

Student response earns one of the following points.
